Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fibrinolytic Agents in Peripheral Arterial Ischaemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive intra-arterial recombinant tissue plasminogen activator (rt-PA), intra-arterial streptokinase, or intravenous rt-PA.

Participants.evidence: 687 participants with peripheral arterial occlusion. Participants were recruited from multiple clinical settings. Eligibility criteria included confirmed peripheral arterial occlusion.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive intra-arterial recombinant tissue plasminogen activator (rt-PA), intra-arterial streptokinase, or intravenous rt-PA.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of fibrinolytic agents.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was vessel patency at 30 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 687 participants.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Vessel patency was significantly greater with intra-arterial rt-PA compared to intra-arterial streptokinase (P < 0.04) and intravenous rt-PA (P < 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Haemorrhagic complications were more frequent with intravenous rt-PA and intra-arterial streptokinase than with intra-arterial rt-PA (P < 0.05).
